required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: High Intensity Resistance Training Combined With Blood Flow Restricted Exercise in Elite Handball Players
clinical_study.official_title: High Intensity Resistance Training Combined With Blood Flow Restricted Exercise in Elite Handball Players

brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose of the study is: to investigate the effects of 8 weeks intervention of high intensity resistance training(HIRT) combined with Blood Flow Restricted Exercise (BFRE) compared to high intensity resistance training alone.
Detailed Description: 30 elite handball players will be randomized into 2 groups of 15 participants each. Participants will be evaluated in the week before and the week after an 8-weeks training intervention with 2 weekly sessions. Based on their baseline muscle strength the participants will be randomized into two groups: HIRT-BFRE or HIRT-HIRT. Participants in both groups will perform a full-body training programme of HIRT. After the Full-body programme, Back squat exercise with low intensity and Blood flow restriction will be performed to the HIRT-BFRE group and back squat exercise with high intensity without blood flow restriction will be performed by HIRT-HIRT. Evaluation protocol includes: muscle strength measurement with 1 repetition maximum of Back squat and knee extension, muscle mass with Dual-Energy X-ray absorptiometry, muscle thickness of the thigh with ultra sound measurement, vertical jump height with linear Encoder, sprint performance with 30m sprint time.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline measurements at week 1, after four weeks of exercise at week 5 and post intervention at week 10.
primary_outcome.description: Change in 1 RM (repetition maximum) muscle strength in back squat

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline measurements at week 1 and post intervention at week 10.
secondary_outcome.description: Change in lean body mass assessed by Dual Energy X-ray Absorptiometry

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline measurements at week 1 and post intervention at week 10.
other_outcome.description: Change in jump height. Change in vertical jump height (in cm, with Chronojump Linear Encoder Kit). Participants will perform a counter movement jump and jump as high as possible. The jump height will be recorded.

other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline measurements at week 1 and post intervention at week 10.
other_outcome.description: Sprint performance. Change in sprint time (in seconds, with Witt speed gates). Participant will perform a 30-meter sprint on an indoor handball court. The time to perform a 30-meter sprint will be recorded.

arm_group.description: High intensity Resistance training combined with Blood Flow

intervention.description: A full-training programme with high intensity followed by back squat exercise with blood flow restriction. Inflatable cuffs will be placed proximally on both thighs. The cuff pressure will be 50% of individual arterial occlusion pressure and will be maintained during the rest intervals. Participants will perform 30, 15, 15 and 15 repetitions of 30% of 1 Repetition Maximum. Totally 75 repetitions will be performed. 45 seconds rest interval between sets will be given.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age >= 18 years
- Ds
- Minimum of 2 years of resistance training experience
- >< Two resistance training sessions each week
- >< three handball sessions each week
- No injuries that prevent participants to perform test of maximal muscle strength
- No injuries, that affects the muscle strength or the ability to train
Exclusion Criteria:
- Elevated blood pressure (>140/90)
- Anabolic steroids or prescription-only medical products with know or potential effect on muscle hypertrophy

clinical_study.keyword: The focus is blood flow restricted exercise
